text:
eh, I wonder why redefine `Base.:+` can work, but these won't be work
```Base.:¬(p::Bool) = !p # negative
Base.:∧(p::Bool, q::Bool) = p && q #conjunction
Base.:∨(p::Bool, q::Bool) = p || q #disjunction
Base.:→(p::Bool, q::Bool) = begin #implication
  !(p == true && q == false)
end

Base.:↔(p::Bool, q::Bool) = p == q #equivalence```
can you help me out ??

elements.text: can work, but these won't be work

Base.:¬(p::Bool) = !p # negative
Base.:∧(p::Bool, q::Bool) = p && q #conjunction
Base.:∨(p::Bool, q::Bool) = p || q #disjunction
Base.:→(p::Bool, q::Bool) = begin #implication
  !(p == true && q == false)
end

Base.:↔(p::Bool, q::Bool) = p == q #equivalence

text:
This operators aren't defined in Base, so you can't redefine what's not defined. Just
```¬(p::Bool) = !p```
works.
